alert.note: Alert for Beaver; Juab; Millard; Piute; Sanpete; Sevier (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 28 at 3:21AM MST until February 28 at 4:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Sanpete County in central Utah... Southeastern Millard County in central Utah... Western Piute County in central Utah... Southeastern Juab County in central Utah... Western Sevier County in central Utah... Eastern Beaver County in southern Utah... * Until 400 AM MST * At 319 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 14 miles west of Nephi to 11 miles north of Fillmore to near Cove Fort to 8 miles southwest of Beaver, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 103 and 212. Interstate 70 between mile markers 0 and 26. US Route 50 between mile markers 111 and 149. US Route 89 between mile markers 185 and 191. Utah Route 21 between mile markers 99 and 107. Locations impacted include... Beaver, Fillmore, Scipio, Kanosh, Marysvale, Meadow, Fayette, Cove Fort, Sevier, Holden, Joseph, Flowell, Manderfield, Greenwood, Yuba Lake State Park, Hatton and Mills. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED

area.areaDesc: Beaver; Juab; Millard; Piute; Sanpete; Sevier
